Posts.Content: On May 24, 2012 2:18 AMkah49wrote: hello, was just wondering if someone could answer a question for me. in 2007, i was diagnosed with stage 2, e/p and her2 positive breast cancer, and in 2011, diagnosed with stage 1 ae thyroid cancer.   doing really good so far, last pet scan in january of this year was clear!   my question is, about two years ago, i found a lump on the under side of my upper arm. my chemo dr called it something but i can't remember what, but he said it was fairly common and it is something to do with the lymph system. i think he called it lympitis or lymphoids, something like that. but, like i said, the pet scan was clear, (i have had two scans since i found it and they were both clear of disease). now i have found another one on my other arm in the same position. does anyone know what this is? i have tried looking on the net, but since i can't remember what it's called, i can't find anything. any answers well be really welcomed.    thank you, kathy I would suggest going to a naturalpath A doctor who also uses herbs to reduce lymph inflammation. Also, if it is cancerous, Dr. Bruzynski in Texas can help you.  God be with you! Bonnie G
Posts.Title: lumps under arms

Posts.Content: I would suggest going to a naturalpath A doctor who also uses herbs to reduce lymph inflammation. Also, if it is cancerous, Dr. Bruzynski in Texas can help you.   Bonnie Garoutte
